defaultCourses.review: I have learned alot about software engineering and website building in this course
Learning program structure is not easy, but the work was manageable to some extent. C can be tricky to learn though.
Very good professor. Teaches introductory java and basic programming concepts are easy to understand.
Very friendly and helpful. Always available and ready to assist you in problems.

Edo knows his stuff cold. His lectures are a little dry but he is very smart. If you ever have a question, make sure to ask because you can fall behind quickly if you are lost. Book was not used. Attendance is not mandatory but good luck passing without going to class.

Professor Halverson has YouTube videos that helps you complete the programming assignments when you are stuck. As long as you do the homework, refer to the textbook, and look for any notes either online or through his videos, you'll do great.

defaultProfessorReviews.review: Easiest Writing Intensive A class you'll take only requires 3 paragraphs for each essay. WOD's are not hard and are really similar to the practice WOD's he gives. Professor basically hands you an A on a silver platter. The professor is a nice guy also and he is willing to help out at any time.

Very all or nothing type of grader. His Workout of the day assignments are relentless and unforgiving(100 points each and he will give you a 0/100 if your code isnt perfect). If you plan on trying to get an A in this class, you must know how to code Javascipt like a seasoned software developer.

Dont get the raving reviews about him, hes just your average researcher 1st professor 2nd. If you can learn from slides great, otherwise he doesn't provide a clear model of the material hes teaching. This is a combination of him speaking rapidly and cramming everything into his lectures.I cant say the homework or examples prepare you for the exam.

Casanova is a very thorough instructor. He provides a lot of information and sometimes it is hard to take it all in, but he's very fair. Just go to office hours for homework help (start assignments early!). Study his slides for quizzes /exams, and you will do fine. Final is a lot like midterm. There is some extra credit opportunity. Do not fall behind!

Cam Moore has a talent for explaining concepts quickly and simply, in ways that are easy to absorb and understand. He also is quite helpful, and you can tell he cares that people actually understand the homework.

There's a quiz every week, plus two midterms and there's not enough time to complete them. Most coding quizzes I don't get the chance to finish, no matter how well I understand the material since we're only given two minutes. He spends class time going over how to do the homework, which I appreciate. Unless you have friends, you work alone in lab.
